page.title: 12BENENDEN WEALD, HYGIENE.
page.content: Various hygienic measures ensure healthy surroundings for the cows at Forest Farm. These include vaccinations against various diseases, neutralization of urea and the extensive use of disinfectants. The herd is given annual tuberculosis tests, any cow found to have this disease is immediately destroyed. Another disease which is common amongst dairy cows is mastitis and a test for this is carried out as soon as a cow has calved. Infected milk congeals and this is shown up by a black dish.To prevent mastitis spreading a new paper is used to wipe down the udder of each cow before and after milking. foot disease has been a problem on the damp ground but now, the cows are subjected to regular foot baths of formalin. Cows are put into separate cubicles and excreta removed.
